issues.description: The problem statement (and UML) specifies a method addGuestStudents(int, String): void — i.e., it should accept an int and a String reason — but the solution implementation provides addGuestStudents(int) with only a single int parameter. This mismatch in method parameters will confuse students (and automated tests) because the expected signature (two parameters) does not match the reference implementation (one parameter).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's addGuestStudents method match the specification/UML by changing its signature to accept both parameters: public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason). Update the implementation to use or document the reason parameter (e.g., record or log it) or at least accept and ignore it, so students and tests relying on the two-parameter signature are consistent. Alternatively, if the intention was a single-parameter method, update the problem statement and UML to reflect addGuestStudents(int) and remove the reason parameter from the specification.

issues.description: The problem statement (and UML) require a method addGuestStudents(int, String) that accepts a number of new guest students and a reason (String). The solution implementation provides addGuestStudents(int) with only a single int parameter (no String reason). This mismatch in the method signature between the problem specification and the solution creates a mapping conflict: students implementing the method as specified in the exercise will find the solution uses a different API, and students inspecting the solution for guidance may be confused about the required parameters and expected behavior.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's method signature match the problem/UML by changing the solution implementation to: public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason) { ... } (optionally use the reason or record it). Alternatively, if the intention is only to add a number without a reason, update the problem statement and UML to specify addGuestStudents(int) to keep artifacts consistent.
